page.title: 09PRINCES ROW,LONGWORTH(1)
page.content: my house was probably oriinally built in the sixteenth century and then appears to have been at least partially burnt down.(we can tell this because heating has turned some of the stone red)we think it was a yeoman farmers house.after the fire the ruin of the old yeomans house was built into two cottages making the house thinner and lower (the centre beam for example is not in the centre now.)the fireplaces were not altered and so they were much too large for small labourers cottages.one end was added about one hundred years ago it was a strange shape and is built of different stone. This end has at different times been a shop and a coffee tavern.The people that used to own the house were called Prince(that is why our house is called Princes Row).They were rose growers & their workers lived in the house.
